verse: You are God’s children whom he loves, so ·try to be like [imitate] him.
·Live a life of love [Walk in love] just as Christ loved us and gave himself for us as a ·sweet-smelling [fragrant] offering and sacrifice to God.

So ·have nothing to do with them [or do not partner/associate with them].

·Light brings [For the fruit of the light is] every kind of goodness, ·right living [righteousness], and truth.
·Try to learn [Discern; Test and prove] what pleases the Lord.
·Have nothing to do with [Take no part in] the things done in darkness, which are ·not worth anything [unfruitful]. But ·show that they are wrong [expose them].
[For] It is shameful even to talk about what those people do in secret.
But the light makes all things ·easy to see [visible; exposed],
and everything that is ·made easy to see [visible; exposed] ·can become [or becomes a; is] light. This is why it is said:
So be very careful how you ·live [walk]. Do not ·live [walk] like those who are ·not wise [foolish], but ·live wisely [like those who are wise].
·Take advantage of every opportunity [or Make the most of your time; …redeeming the time/season], because ·these are evil times [the days are evil].

·Speak […speaking] to each other with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making music in your hearts to the Lord.
·Always give […always giving] thanks to God the Father for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

·Yield [Submit; Be subject; …yielding/submitting; grammatically linked to the previous sentence, and so part of being filled with the Spirit] to each other out of ·reverence [respect; fear; awe] for Christ.

This ·secret [mystery] is ·very important [or great; profound]—I am talking about Christ and the church.
·But [However; In any case; or To sum up] each one of you must love his wife as he loves himself, and a wife must ·respect [reverence; v. 21] her husband.
